results.title: Mutual amplification of apoptosis by statin-induced mitochondrial stress and doxorubicin toxicity in human rhabdomyosarcoma cells.
results.text_hl: Alternative pathways via death receptors, that is, @GENE_CASP8 @GENE_841 @@@caspase 8@@@ or calpain activation, were not triggered by @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@simvastatin@@@. @<m>CHEMICAL_Simvastatin</m> @CHEMICAL_MESH:D019821 @@@Simvastatin@@@-treated @<m>DISEASE_Immunoglobulin_G4_Related_Disease</m> @DISEASE_MESH:D000077733 @@@RD@@@ cells could be completely rescued from apoptosis by the co-application of @CHEMICAL_Mevalonic_Acid @CHEMICAL_MESH:D008798 @@@mevalonic acid@@@, indicating that deprivation of @CHEMICAL_Cholesterol @CHEMICAL_MESH:D002784 @@@cholesterol@@@ precursors is essential for statin-induced apoptosis.

citations.NLM: Werner M, Sacher J, Hohenegger M. Mutual amplification of apoptosis by statin-induced mitochondrial stress and doxorubicin toxicity in human rhabdomyosarcoma cells. Br J Pharmacol. 2004 Nov;143(6):715-24. PMID: 15289292
